body: I only like non-requirement dependencies/preconditions/whatever to be listed - things like OS or any system level packages we might need (for instance, tkinter to display renderings of a graph layout natively). Things that you would `apt install` or `brew install` or whatever - those things make sense. I'm always looking in setup.py or requirements.txt for my stuff on *any* project anyway presuming that's the ground truth and the documentation is a lie, because that's usually how it is - and we have a great example of that right now! :D
Fine with me. You can see it as it updates here as well (https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/network/dependencies)
Hi all, I like to contribute to this issue if  this issue still open ??
Hi @rajpratyush - thanks for your interest! You are welcome to work on this one, do you need any info from us?

issue.title: Tutorial / Examples for automatic layouts
issue.body: A jupyter notebook tutorial for automatic layouts would be super useful, along with the graphs rendered.

body: Yes, can you guide me lil bit as I was highly impressed by your idea of automatic updating of dependencies in case they are depreciated or updated. I am highly interested in working on this idea. @bdpedigo

> Yes, can you guide me lil bit as I was highly impressed by your idea of automatic updating of dependencies in case they are depreciated or updated. I am highly interested in working on this idea. @bdpedigo

Appreciate the enthusiasm, but I think for now we just want to remove the dependencies section from the README file here https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/README.md#python-dependencies
